ovdesc.p: The purpose of this table is to define a fixed Account charge to be applied if a specified Balance is not maintained.
The General Charge record, referred to in the relevant Group or ACCOUNT.DEBIT.INT record, specifies whether or not this charge is applicable to an Account.
A range of charges for different Balances may be specified.
The required Balance may be defined as the Minimum or Average Balance over a given period.

The charge is applied monthly, quarterly or six monthly as specified in the Company record. The General Charge record specifies whether the calculation is in one step, covering the balances over the whole period, or in monthly steps, applying the appropriate charge for each month during which the required Balance is not maintained.
The Balance Requirement record which is in effect on the date of the charges capitalisation defines the calculation rules for the whole capitalisation period.

desc.p: Defines the Currency for which the Balance Requirement Charge details in the associated Sub-fields 11-12 apply. For Accounts in Currencies with no input in this Field, the Default Amounts specified in Fields 8-9 are used.

This multivalue field is to be used to record all Currencies for which specific Balance Requirement charges are to be made. Where a balance Requirement charge is based on the Currency equivalent of the local value charge, only Fields 8 and 9 should be completed.

3 SWIFT character or 3 numeric character currency code. Multivalue field associated with sub-value Fields 11 and 12. (Optional input if input made to corresponding Fields 8 and 9, otherwise mandatory.)
This is the Balance Requirement code and effective date which form a key to which General Charge records may be linked.
The date may be entered as:
1) YYYY-MM year-month 2) YYYYMM yearmonth 3) MM-YY month-year 4) MMYY monthyear or 5) MM month (current year assumed)
The month may be 01-12 or 1-12.
It is always displayed formatted YYYY-MM. For new input the date may not be earlier than today.
The Balance Requirement record which is in effect on the date of the charges capitalisation defines the calculation rules for the whole capitalisation period.

1) 1-2 numeric characters (Mandatory input). 2) '-' (Mandatory input if date is input, otherwise no input). Prime Site '.' 3) 1-7 date characters, year and month. (Optional input, default is current year and month). Altering an existing BALANCE.REQUIREMENT record does not cause any adjustment to charges already processed.

Specifies the local currency equivalent of the Balance below which the charge specified in corresponding DEF.CHARGE.AMT will be made, if there are no details in field range CURRENCY to CHARGE.AMT for the Currency of the Account.
If various levels of charge are to be applied up to various Balance limits, multivalue fields DEFAULT.BAL.AMT and DEF.CHARGE.AMT are used to specify these in ascending Balance sequence.

The amounts and charges specified in fields DEFAULT.BAL.AMT and DEF.CHARGE.AMT are in local currency equivalent and apply to Accounts in Currencies not specifically covered by field range CURRENCY to CHARGE.AMT.
It is possible to specify local currency as a value for multivalue field CURRENCY.
1-14 numeric characters plus a decimal point. Multivalue field associated with DEF.CHARGE.AMT. (Mandatory input if no input to CURRENCY, otherwise optional.)
Describes the Balance Requirement Charge, and can be used for reporting.
The Description may be entered in each of the Languages defined in the LANGUAGE table (Ref: General Tables).
It will be displayed in the Language specified in the User Record of the person using the System.
3-35 type A (alphanumeric) characters. Multilanguage field. (Mandatory input)
Specifies the charge to be made on Account Balances less than that specified in corresponding field DEFAULT.BAL.AMT.
If various levels of charge are to be applied up to various Balance limits, multivalue fields DEFAULT.BAL.AMT and DEF.CHARGE.AMT are used to specify these in ascending balance sequence.
The amounts and charges specified in fields DEFAULT.BAL.AMT and DEF.CHARGE.AMT are in local currency and apply to accounts in currencies not specifically covered by CURRENCY.
It is possible to specify local currency as a value for multivalue field CURRENCY.
1-14 numeric characters plus a decimal point. Multivalue field associated with DEFAULT.BAL.AMT. (Mandatory input if input made to corresponding field DEFAULT.BAL.AMT, otherwise not allowed.)
Identifies the Transaction Code to be assigned to Profit and Loss entries generated for Balance Requirement Charges.
1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code. (Mandatory Input)
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
It must be a valid code on the TRANSACTION table (Ref: General Tables).
The Debit Credit Indicator in the TRANSACTION table record must be CREDIT.
The charge to be made on account balances less than the balance specified in corresponding sub-value field BALANCE.AMT, for accounts in the currency specified in corresponding field CURRENCY.

Various levels of charge may be applied up to various balance limits, for Accounts in the Currency specified in CURRENCY. This sub-value field specifies the appropriate charge in ascending balance sequence.
1-14 numeric characters plus a decimal point. (Sub-value field associated with sub-value field BALANCE.AMT and multivalue field CURRENCY).
Identifies the Transaction Code to be assigned to Account entries generated for Balance Requirement Charges.
1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code. (Mandatory Input)
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
It must be a valid code on the TRANSACTION table.
The Debit Credit Indicator in the TRANSACTION table record must be DEBIT.
Identifies the Tax record which specifies the calculation and processing of Tax applicable to the Balance Requirement Charge.

Up to 2 numeric character Tax code. (Optional input) There must be an existing record for this code on the TAX table (Ref: General Tables), with effective date less than or equal to the effective date of this record.

This multivalue field is to be used to record all Currencies for which specific Balance Requirement charges are to be made. Where a balance Requirement charge is based on the Currency equivalent of the local value charge, only Fields 8 and 9 should be completed.

3 SWIFT character or 3 numeric character currency code. Multivalue field associated with sub-value Fields 11 and 12. (Optional input if input made to corresponding Fields 8 and 9, otherwise mandatory.)
The Balance Amount, in the Currency specified in CURRENCY field, below which the charge specified in corresponding CHARGE.AMT field will be made.

Various levels of charge may be applied up to various balance limits, for Accounts in the Currency specified in CURRENCY. Sub-value fields BALANCE.AMT and CHARGE.AMT are used to specify these in ascending balance sequence.

1-14 numeric characters plus a decimal point. Sub-value field associated with sub-value field CHARGE.AMT and multivalue field CURRENCY. (Mandatory input if input made to corresponding field CURRENCY, otherwise not allowed.
Specifies whether the Balance Requirement Charge is to be based on an Average or Minimum Account Balance.

Depending on the CALCUL.STEP.PERIOD field in the associated GENERAL.CHARGE record, the Average or Minimum Balance will be calculated either in monthly steps or for the whole of the charge period as defined in the associated Company record.
AVERAGE or MINIMUM or any abbreviation thereof.
This field is reserved for future expansion.
This is a NOINPUT field.
Identifies the Category code to be assigned to Profit and Loss (credit) entries generated as a result of making a Balance Requirement charge.
4 or 5 numeric character Category code. (Mandatory input)
It must be a valid code on the CATEGORY table (Ref: General Tables).
System Indicator in Category record must be PL.
